item.title: ALLOW THROUGH / CASES OR WHAT? == Need Real Coders
item.dc:creator: @SeySayux SeySayux
item.description:
@SeySayux wrote:

easy…
add these booleans:

[code] public boolean hasFullSaradomin() {
if (playerEquipment[playerHat] == 2665 && (playerEquipment[playerLegs] == 2663 || playerEquipment[playerLegs] == 3479) && playerEquipment[playerShield] == 2667 && playerEquipment[playerChest] == 2661) return true;
return false;
}

public boolean hasFullZamorak() {
if (playerEquipment[playerHat] == 2657 && (playerEquipment[playerLegs] == 2655 || playerEquipment[playerLegs] == 3478) && playerEquipment[playerShield] == 2659 && playerEquipment[playerChest] == 2653) return true;
return false;
}

boolean fullZamorak = false;
boolean fullSaradomin = false;[/code]

add this to your process boolean:

if (hasFullZamorak) fullZamorak = true; if (hasFullSaradomin) fullSaradomin = true;

now just use the fullzamorak and fullsaradomin booleans to check if a player is allowed to enter…

Read full topic

item.title: ALLOW THROUGH / CASES OR WHAT? == Need Real Coders
item.dc:creator: @Newb_2341 Newb 2341
item.description:
@Newb_2341 wrote:

OK, I’m trying to add a code that makes you HAVE to wear one clans armour (zammy/sara) to play team pk.

Now, wouldn’t it be a case, ie:

case ID OF THE ITEMS (can you add more then one?); if (objectX == obj. ID? && objectY == obj. ID?) } sendMessage("Message"); Then what?

Or:

[code]if IDs OF ITEMS
? == true;
(Something, let through most likely.)

else if IDs OF ITEMS
? == false;
sendMessage(“Message”)
(Something, not allow through…)[/code]

I am almost guarnteed it is one of those or is along the lines of one of those, but I need help from SOME REAL CODERS!
[br][size=1]Posted on: March 30, 2007, 09:59:43 PM[/size][hr]Help please?
